zone.line: Some The bound It has been conceded to some men to pass the
boundaries of the age in which they live, & knowledge of the age in
which they livee.— These were in remote antiquity & to posess powers

line.del: which have never yet been equalled.

zone.line: happens that circumstances foreign from the with any superior
wisdom in the individual whom they invest. Circumstances
from thier own distinct from any thier own wisdom frequently
in conspire to invest them with this prerogative. Let none
suppose Let none suppose that the preeminence which it
confers is useful to the posessor! He is If the his fellow
men neither worship him as a God, fear as a demon or
persecute him as an enemy — yet the power itself
if disproportioned to the skill which should weild
it might contain a germ of inexhautible misfortune.
